string_table.name: pxabnsnfns10111101101
string_table.string: Closed captions. Press the spacebar to toggle captions on and off.
Skip Navigation. Hit enter to return to the slide.

slidelink.displaytext: We need to write a paper
Can you ever use outside sources?

resource_data.description: Help with Citations & Academic Honesty

slidetranscripts.slidetranscript: <Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Welcome to this presentation on academic honesty.To move through the presentation, click the Next button in the lower right-hand corner of the screen.If you’d like to review a specific topic, click on that topic name in the menu on the left-hand navigation." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="What do you already know about academic honesty? Click the Let’s Go! button, and we’ll find out." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="True or False: It’s okay to use other people’s information in your essay if you name the source." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="True or False: It’s okay to turn in a paper that you wrote for a different class." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="True or False: It’s okay to write a paper in your native language and use software to translate it into English. " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="True or False: It’s okay to get help from an HCC tutor when you are writing a paper." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Academic honesty means that any work that you turn in with your name on it is truly and honestly your own work.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="No cheating, no copying, no buying work off the Internet, no reusing a paper you wrote for another class, no translating passages with software, and no plagiarizing." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="So, can you ever use outside sources for your work?
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Yes! Sometimes you will be required to use outside sources in your work. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="In your classes, you will learn ways to include outside sources in your work without plagiarizing.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="In the meantime, don’t use outside sources unless it is part of your assignment." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Plagiarism means using someone else’s words or ideas as if they were your own, either intentionally or unintentionally.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Plagiarism includes cutting and pasting an author’s words, copying an author’s words without quotation marks and the author’s name, changing the author’s words around without giving him or her credit." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Plagiarism is a very serious offense in all academic institutions, including HCC.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="It can affect your paper’s grade, your course grade, and your academic record." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="You know plagiarism is wrong, so how can you use someone else’s idea in your paper without plagiarizing?
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="The first thing you need to do is identify key information about the source. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Identify the TITLE of the source, WHO wrote the idea you want to use, WHEN they wrote it, WHERE the information is located.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="You need to keep track of this information so that you and others can find your original source after reading the information in your paper. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Let’s take a look at an example.
" /> </Block> <Block /> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Let's review. How can you avoid plagiarizing?
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Cite your sources, both in the text and in your bibliography. This includes ANY source that is not your original work.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="In-text citations typically include the author’s last name, year of publication, and/or page number.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="You must cite the source, whether you paraphrase or directly quote their words.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="APA and MLA are two of the acceptable styles for citations. Ask your instructor which you should use.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="We cite sources not only to avoid plagiarizing, but because it can help us and our reader to locate the original source of the text or idea.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="There are consequences if you plagiarize, whether intentionally or inadvertently, so remember to cite your sources, and ask for help if you need it." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="What have you learned about academic honesty?" /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Can you ever use information from the Internet in your essay?" /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Do you get a zero if you did not INTEND to plagiarize?" /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="What is it called when you, in your own words, use an author's ideas in your paper?
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block /> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Is it okay to use Google Translate when you write essays for your class?" /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="What happens if you plagiarize in an assignment?" /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="If you wrote an essay for a different class, can you use it in your English class, too?" /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Congratulations! You now know the importance of academic honesty." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>
